posts.cooked:
Yes, this has been discussed countless times over and over but now it‚Äôs high time for you as a responsible team to understand that not everyone is living on the edge of technology and they are just beginning to learn which they never had to before.

There are many instances that can get someone‚Äôs life negatively affected once the spamming takes over. We are very well aware of these abuses, from harmless to harmful contents. And there is no fix yet!

Now, allowing nobody to find by number option provides very limited scope as person who already got your number or some spammer who just happen to use it for targeted advertisements etc. can easily create chaos in someone‚Äôs life! We can‚Äôt report and block all of them as this is a cat and mouse game which never ends.

Signal needs to implement this function at earliest to allow people to talk with whom they actually want to without getting themselves dragged in to such undesired situations.

This is Signal we are talking about not Meta. Standard we set are usually followed by the rest and we are failing in this area miserably.

Sincerely hope you guys are already taking this on priority.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: You can already hide your number from being searchable, and hide your number from visibility in groups. This doesn‚Äôt stop someone that has already started a conversation though. At that point you need to block and report the user.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
desmond:

Signal needs to implement this function at earliest to allow people to talk with whom they actually want to without getting themselves dragged in to such undesired situations.

as in, message requests, PNP and the ability to rotate usernames, all features which exist?
also see the ways to deal with spam if you‚Äôre exposed to it listed here:

Signal Wiki ‚Äì 10 Mar 24

Privacy tips - Signal Wiki

rassilon1963:

see the ways to deal with spam if you‚Äôre exposed to it listed here

Though you can‚Äôt rotate the UUID without re-registering AFAIK. If spammers obtain that through a custom client, they can reach you even with contact discovery off and no or unknown username.

It‚Äôs not entirely clear what the exact functionality you‚Äôre requesting is, but you already have the ability to hide your phone number, and message requests are already a thing. Sounds like maybe a whitelist request:

Whitelist/ blacklist Feature Requests
I would like to see a list of all my blocked contacts in a blacklist, and be able to edit it. I would also like the ability to switch to using a whitelist aswell, and be able to edit that list too. It would be nice to switch between the two lists, either using one or the other. If both lists could remain unchanged while I switch between them at will, that would be great. The lists should not change unless I explicitly change them. The default list would be the blacklist.

Tried all that including switching to usernames only mode but not helping. Also, we can‚Äôt stop anyone who just happen to find our numbers and begin to spam! And as Signal has grown a lot, so is these abuses.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
desmond:

Tried all that including switching to usernames only mode

That‚Äôs not a thing. Are you talking about hiding your number?

desmond:

Also, we can‚Äôt stop anyone who just happen to find our numbers

That‚Äôs not really possible in general, and not at all possible if you‚Äôve hidden your number from being searchable on Signal.

We tried to do that but not effective against spammers. Many reasons too. Rotating users names are really good and let me say thank you for that! But real problem is numbers. Once our numbers are compromised by any means, (recycled or found in some database or maybe a lucky guess etc.), we are screwed for life! Imagine this! We can‚Äôt run away from these people no matter what we do. And we can‚Äôt keep buying new numbers to find a temporary shelter as this can easily happen again.

Yes, correct. Numbers are kept hidden and discoverability is also off so one can only use usernames to get going.

There are two issues there. One is that by default numbers are still available to get connected. Second is numbers themselves are abused! Meaning recycling etc. create more issues. And third is the spammers continue to just add to random groups even with everything off.

What I think would be a good balance is to have an option to allow connections from select few. Rest are blocked. More deeply rooted problem is reliance on numbers. This is good and bad. Good part is people can find each other easily but this is also true for spammers. So here Signal can only allow people within a user‚Äôs contact list to get connected.

Maybe a more aggressive approach would be an option to ask users if they only want to use usernames as a way to communicate or not (this is more like hardening)? This selection can allow Signal to completely turn off dependability on numbers except for registration.

Also, in real world most people resort to using a default mode of the app which still exposes numbers so this too is another concern.

desmond:

What I think would be a good balance is to have an option to allow connections from select few

That‚Äôs a whitelist, which is the existing feature request I linked above.

desmond:

Maybe a more aggressive approach would be an option to ask users if they only want to use usernames as a way to communicate or not (this is more like hardening)? This selection can allow Signal to completely turn off dependability on numbers except for registration.

This is already a feature: set ‚Äúwho can see my phone number‚Äù and ‚Äúwho can find me by phone number‚Äù both to ‚Äúnobody‚Äù.

More details:
https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/6712070553754-Phone-Number-Privacy-and-Usernames

Numbers still exposed with default settings, correct? As we are not turning off both of those options. So as we set up the app, users could be introduced to such options with a single click that effectively makes primary mode of communication using only user names. Anything that needs more fine tuning is again more friction most won‚Äôt want that.

On a side note, maybe we could borrow some insight from Molly on this part where they have feature to block all unknown contacts?

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
desmond:

One is that by default numbers are still available to get connected.

New users are asked if they want to set both to ‚Äúnobody‚Äù during onboarding. If they don‚Äôt choose ‚Äúnobody‚Äù, that‚Äôs not a flaw with Signal.

desmond:

And third is the spammers continue to just add to random groups even with everything off.

Spammers can‚Äôt send messages to other users on Signal without: 1. Knowing a number, 2. The number being registered on Signal, and 3. The user has not set phone number discoverability to ‚Äúnobody‚Äù. If a user has set 3. to ‚Äúnobody‚Äù, then a spammer will never find a particular user because their number is not exposed to the searchable number space.

desmond:

Numbers still exposed with default settings, correct?

I‚Äôm 90% sure users are presented with the phone number privacy options during the installation process, but I haven‚Äôt gone through the new process myself since I‚Äôve never reset my Signal installation, so someone else would have to confirm that.

Edit: looks like @Avitus confirmed before I posted

Wait where does Signal ask that? I don‚Äôt see that happen upon fresh install. Default it allows to be visible across the network. Tested both Google Play and direct APK (with verification in check). But again, spammers are somehow finding a way to add to random groups even with all is off. This is happens on notoriously fast level and my guess is automated so users don‚Äôt even get a chance to reach to the advanced steps.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
if you‚Äôre not seeing that screen it‚Äôs a bug you should report on GitHub.
i would make sure first that we‚Äôre talking about the same thing though. when you register from 0, not reregister an existing account, do you not see a screen asking for your phone number permissions?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Registering will not rotate ACI
Deleting the account and joining agan?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: There is no way to rotate your ACI, deleting won‚Äôt help.
This means they keep track of deleted accounts on Signal servers to remember the phone number to ACI mapping.

fancy_title: Not blocking unknown contacts numbers can destroy someone’s peaceful life!
title: Not blocking unknown contacts numbers can destroy someone's peaceful life!
